title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
short_description: A comprehensive and practical guide to building good habits and breaking bad ones through small changes.

title: Tiny Habits
author: BJ Fogg
short_description: Focuses on small actions that can be done in less than thirty seconds to build sustainable habits.

title: The Power of Habit
author: Charles Duhigg
short_description: Explores the science behind why habits exist and how they can be changed.

title: Python Crash Course
author: Eric Matthes
short_description: A fast-paced, thorough introduction to programming with Python that will have you writing programs to solve problems quickly.

title: Automate the Boring Stuff with Python
author: Al Sweigart
short_description: Practical programming for total beginners, focusing on simple scripts to automate mundane tasks.

title: Fluent Python
author: Luciano Ramalho
short_description: A deep dive into Python's features for experienced programmers who want to write idiomatic Python code.

title: Salt Fat Acid Heat
author: Samin Nosrat
short_description: Master the four elements of good cooking to instinctively create delicious meals without recipes.

title: The Food Lab
author: J. Kenji LÃ³pez-Alt
short_description: A massive guide to the science of cooking, explaining the 'why' behind techniques and recipes.

title: Deep Work
author: Cal Newport
short_description: Rules for focused success in a distracted world, teaching you how to master hard things quickly.

title: Getting Things Done
author: David Allen
short_description: The art of stress-free productivity, presenting a system to organize your life and clear your mind.

title: The Rise and Fall of the Third Reich
author: William L. Shirer
short_description: A monumental history of Nazi Germany, covering its birth, rise to power, and ultimate destruction.

title: Stalingard
author: Antony Beevor
short_description: A gripping account of the turning point of World War II, focused on the brutal battle of Stalingrad.

title: Guns Germs and Steel
author: Jared Diamond
short_description: A short history of everybody for the last 13,000 years, arguing geography shaped modern world inequalities.

title: Japanese Cooking: A Simple Art
author: Shizuo Tsuji
short_description: The bible of Japanese cooking, covering ingredients, tools, and techniques in detail.

title: Thinking Fast and Slow
author: Daniel Kahneman
short_description: Explains the two systems that drive the way we think: System 1 is fast and emotional; System 2 is slower and logical.

title: Zero to One
author: Peter Thiel
short_description: Notes on startups and how to build the future, focusing on creating something new rather than copying.

title: The Lean Startup
author: Eric Ries
short_description: How today's entrepreneurs use continuous innovation to create radically successful businesses.

title: HTML and CSS: Design and Build Websites
author: Jon Duckett
short_description: A visually rich guide to HTML and CSS, perfect for beginners who are visual learners.

title: Eloquent JavaScript
author: Marijn Haverbeke
short_description: A modern introduction to programming with JavaScript, diving deep into the language's capabilities.

title: The Second World War
author: Antony Beevor
short_description: A comprehensive single-volume history of World War II, weaving together the global conflict.

title: Clean Code
author: Robert C. Martin
short_description: A handbook of agile software craftsmanship, teaching how to write code that is easy to understand and maintain.

title: Design Patterns
author: Erich Gamma et al.
short_description: Elements of reusable object-oriented software, a classic text on software architecture solutions.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
short_description: Explores how biology and history have defined us and enhanced our understanding of what it means to be human.

title: Band of Brothers
author: Stephen E. Ambrose
short_description: The story of the men of Easy Company, 506th Parachute Infantry Regiment, 101st Airborne Division.

title: Leaders Eat Last
author: Simon Sinek
short_description: Why some teams pull together and others don't, focusing on creating a circle of safety.

title: High Output Management
author: Andrew S. Grove
short_description: A legendary guide to the art of managing a company, written by the former CEO of Intel.

title: Kitchen Confidential
author: Anthony Bourdain
short_description: Adventures in the culinary underbelly, offering a raw look at the restaurant industry.

title: Making of the Atomic Bomb
author: Richard Rhodes
short_description: The definitive history of nuclear weapons development, blending science and history.

title: Refactoring
author: Martin Fowler
short_description: Improving the design of existing code, a crucial skill for maintaining long-lived software projects.

title: Extreme Ownership
author: Jocko Willink
short_description: How U.S. Navy SEALs lead and win, applying combat leadership principles to business.

title: The Pragmatic Programmer
author: David Thomas, Andrew Hunt
short_description: Classic advice for software developers on career and craft.

title: Code Complete
author: Steve McConnell
short_description: A massive guide to software construction best practices.

title: Introduction to Algorithms
author: Thomas H. Cormen
short_description: The standard textbook for algorithms and data structures.

title: Head First Design Patterns
author: Eric Freeman
short_description: A visually rich, brain-friendly guide to design patterns.

title: Soft Skills
author: John Sonmez
short_description: A guide to the non-technical aspects of a software developer's life.

title: Don't Make Me Think
author: Steve Krug
short_description: The premier book on web usability and user experience.

title: The Phoenix Project
author: Gene Kim
short_description: A novel about IT, DevOps, and helping your business win.

title: A Short History of Nearly Everything
author: Bill Bryson
short_description: A fascinating journey through the history of science and the universe.

title: Cosmos
author: Carl Sagan
short_description: Explores the 15-billion year evolution of cosmic matter into life and consciousness.

title: The Selfish Gene
author: Richard Dawkins
short_description: Argues that genes are the primary units of selection in evolution.

title: Astrophysics for People in a Hurry
author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
short_description: A quick, digestible guide to the essential concepts of astrophysics.

title: How Not to Be Wrong
author: Jordan Ellenberg
short_description: Shows how math touches everything we do and how to think more clearly.

title: Brief Answers to the Big Questions
author: Stephen Hawking
short_description: Hawking's final thoughts on the universe's biggest questions.

author: David McCullough
short_description: The dramatic story of the year of America's birth.

title: SPQR
author: Mary Beard
short_description: A fresh look at the history of ancient Rome.

title: Genghis Khan and the Making of the Modern World
author: Jack Weatherford
short_description: Revises our understanding of the Mongol Empire and its legacy.

title: The Wright Brothers
author: David McCullough
short_description: The story of the brothers who taught the world how to fly.

title: Devil in the White City
author: Erik Larson
short_description: Intertwines the true tale of the 1893 World's Fair and a serial killer.

title: Influence
author: Robert Cialdini
short_description: The classic book on the psychology of persuasion.

title: Good to Great
author: Jim Collins
short_description: Why some companies make the leap to greatness and others don't.

title: Start with Why
author: Simon Sinek
short_description: How great leaders inspire everyone to take action.

title: Rich Dad Poor Dad
author: Robert Kiyosaki
short_description: Advocates financial independence through investing and financial intelligence.

title: The 4-Hour Workweek
author: Tim Ferriss
short_description: A blueprint for escaping the rat race and living more.

title: Outliers
author: Malcolm Gladwell
short_description: Examines the factors that contribute to high levels of success.

title: Freakonomics
author: Steven Levitt
short_description: Explores the hidden side of everything through economics.

title: Mindset
author: Carol S. Dweck
short_description: The new psychology of success: fixed vs growth mindset.

title: The Joy of Cooking
author: Irma S. Rombauer
short_description: The most popular American cookbook, a kitchen staple.

title: Essentials of Classic Italian Cooking
author: Marcella Hazan
short_description: The bible of Italian cooking for home cooks.

title: On Food and Cooking
author: Harold McGee
short_description: The science and lore of the kitchen.

title: Meditations
author: Marcus Aurelius
short_description: Private notes of the Roman Emperor, a classic of Stoic philosophy.
